description: HiTechnic NXT Sensor Multiplexer Input Port

mode_info.name: analog
mode_info.notes:
[^analog-mode]: The [nxt-analog] driver will be loaded when
    this mode is set. You must manually specify the correct
    driver for your sensor using `set_device` if you want to use
    another driver. Any driver with a connection type of
    Analog/NXT is allowed.
    ^
    [nxt-analog]: /docs/sensors/generic-nxt-analog-sensor

mode_info.name: i2c
mode_info.notes:
[^i2c-mode]: If one of the supported sensors was detected
    by invoking the `DETECT` command on the [ht-nxt-smux]
    associated with this port, then the appropriate driver will
    be automatically loaded. Otherwise, you can use `set_device`
    to load the correct driver for your sensor. Any driver with
    a connection type of I2C/NXT is allowed.
    ^
    [ht-nxt-smux]: /docs/sensors/hitechnic-nxt-sensor-multiplexer

name: ht-nxt-smux-port

connection_types: UART/EV3, UART/Other, I2C/NXT, I2C/Other, Analog/EV3, Analog/NXT

mode_info.name: auto
mode_info.notes:
[^auto-mode]: In auto mode, the port will attempt to
    automatically detect the type of sensor that was connected
    and load the appropriate driver. See the list of [supported
    sensors] to determine if a sensor can be automatically
    detected.
    ^
    [supported sensors]: /docs/sensors/#supported-sensors

mode_info.name: nxt-analog
mode_info.notes:
[^nxt-analog-mode]: This loads the [generic NXT/Analog sensor]
    [nxt-analog] driver. Use `set_device` to load the appropriate
    device/driver.
    ^
    [nxt-analog]: /docs/sensors/generic-nxt-analog-sensor

mode_info.name: nxt-color
mode_info.notes:
[^nxt-color-mode]: NXT Color sensor driver has not been
    implemented yet, so right now, this mode does nothing.

mode_info.description: Configure for I2C communications and load the [nxt-i2c-host] device.
mode_info.name: nxt-i2c

mode_info.description: Configure for UART communications and load the [ev3-uart-host] device.
mode_info.name: ev3-uart

mode_info.description: Configure for UART communications but do not load any device.
mode_info.name: other-uart

mode_info.description: Provide access to low level drivers.
mode_info.name: raw
mode_info.notes:
[^raw-mode]: Exports gpios and analog/digital converter values
    to sysfs so that they can be controlled directly.

name: legoev3-input-port

mode_info.description: Automatically detect motors when they are connected.
mode_info.name: auto
mode_info.notes:
[^auto-mode]: Only the EV3/NXT large motors and the EV3
    medium motor can be automatically detected. All other devices
    must be manually configured.

mode_info.name: legoev3-motor
mode_info.notes:
[^legoev3-motor-mode]: Configures the port to use the
    [legoev3-motor] driver module. The default driver is the
    EV3/NXT Large Motor (`lego-ev3-l-motor`). You can change
    the driver using the `set_device` attribute.
    ^
    [legoev3-motor]: /docs/drivers/legoev3-motor

mode_info.name: rcx-motor
mode_info.notes:
[^rcx-motor-mode]: This can be use with MINDSTORMS RCX
    motors, Power Functions motors and any other 'plain' DC
    motor. By 'plain', we mean the motor is just a motor without
    any feedback.
    ^
    [rcx-motor]: /docs/drivers/rcx-motor

mode_info.name: rcx-led
mode_info.notes:
[^rcx-led-mode]: This can be used with MINDSTORMS RCX LEDs,
    Power Functions LEDs or any other LED connected to pins 1
    and 2 of the output port.
    ^
    [rcx-led]: /docs/drivers/rcx-led

mode_info.description: Provide access to low level drivers.
mode_info.name: raw
mode_info.notes:
[^raw-mode]: Exports gpios, pwm and analog/digital converter
    values to sysfs so that they can be controlled directly.

description: mindsensors.com EV3 Sensor Multiplexer Input Port

mode_info.name: uart
mode_info.notes:
[^uart-mode]: UART sensor types are not automatically
    detected. By default, the `lego-ev3-uart-29` driver (LEGO
    EV3 Color Sensor) will be loaded when this mode is set.
    Use `set_device` to load other sensor devices/drivers.
    
    Supported sensors are:
    
    | Sensor Name         | Device/Driver Name |
    |---------------------|--------------------|
    | LEGO EV3 Color      | `lego-ev3-uart-29` |
    | LEGO EV3 Ultrasonic | `lego-ev3-uart-30` |
    | LEGO EV3 GYRO       | `lego-ev3-uart-32` |
    | LEGO EV3 Infrared   | `lego-ev3-uart-33` |

mode_info.name: analog
mode_info.notes:
[^analog-mode]: Currently only the LEGO EV3 Touch sensor is
    supported. The `lego-ev3-touch` device/driver is loaded when
    this mode is set.

name: ms-ev3-smux-port
